result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric L Whited was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fulltime employment/schooling or if not, 15 verifable/appropriate job searches per month and perform 10 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety
No contact with T.W. unless agent approves contact.
No possession of dangerous weapons.

Assessment as deemed appropriate.
SAFE intake & follow up.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber for work, childcare, counseling, NA/AA or EMP if eligible. 45 days to report or at agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric L Whited

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:52 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF917, 14CF928, 14CF1066, AND 15CF52.
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person with Atty Amanda Ley. 

**BW QUASHED**

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.

State moves to: 
In 14CF917: Ct. 1 (Battery/DA Repeater/Repeater/DA)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (DC/DA Repeater/Repeater/DA)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF928: Ct. 1 (Substantial Battery - Intend Bodily Harm/DA Repeater/Repeater/DA)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (DC/DA Repeater/Repeater/DA)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF1066: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 2 (OAR)>>D&RI. 
                      : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF52: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
                  : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises deft of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques deft to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & deft guilty. 
Deft makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: SAFE Intake and follow-up; AODA; assessments as deemed appropriate; absolute sobriety; fulltime employment/schooling or if not, 15 verifiable/appropriate job searches per month and perform 10 hours CS per week; no possession of dangerous weapons; no contact with T.W. unless agent approves contact; court costs including DNA sample and surcharge.  
COURT ORDERS as CONDITION of Probation on Ct. 1 only - 90 days MCJ with huber for work/childcare/counseling/NA/AA or EMP if eligible - with 45 days to report or at agent's discretion. 
Parties to provide stipulation regarding sentence credit at a later date. 
Atty Ley requests bond be returned to surety, if deft is not bond poster.
COURT grants. 

Adj: 4:07 pm

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:21 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF917, 14CF928, 14CF1066, AND 15CF52. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft does NOT appear - Atty Amanda Ley appears on his behalf. 
Date and time was set for plea hearing. 
State requests bench warrant and bond forfeiture. 
Atty Ley makes statement. 
COURT authorizes $5000 bench warrant to cover all cases and sets BFH for Sept. 28. 2015 at 8:30 am in Br. 2. 
Adj: 3:22 pm
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 9:20 a.m.
**Includes 14CF917, 14CF928, 14CF1066 & 15CF52**
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Kat Jackan for Amanda Ley. Date & time set for Preliminary Hearing in 14CF1066 & 15CF52. 14CF917 & 14CF928 set for Arraignment. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed in both files. 
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed in both files.  Readings Waived.
Plea: NOT GUILTY 
Arraignment in 14CF917 & 14CF928- Information previously filed. Both Readings Waived.
PLEA: NOT GUILTY
CC- 03/31/15 at 1:00 p.m. in Br.2 office. 
Bond to be continued. 
Adj: 9:22 a.m.
org. warrant returned from Sheriff's dept.
Preliminary Hearing on March 30, 2015 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: INCLUDES 14CF1066 & 15CF52 No contact with victim(s): T.W. -NON WAIVABLE Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. 3rd party visitation through Family Resource Center.
